comment.author: 45239423@N08
comment._content: Wow the quality of the photo is impressive. The color makes the picture stand out even more and the amount of detail you are able to see is amazing.

comment.author: 45286462@N08
comment._content: An everyday scene, that hopefully does not get taken for granted. I would of loved to have walked outside and seen this everyday. It is beautiful.

comment.author: 40016553@N03
comment._content: I do not take it for granted when walking or cycling here, it's beautiful in every season and even with rain :-)!

comment.author: 12143670@N05
comment._content:
A wonderful photograph, like the rest of this amazing set.

There's something I don't understand about this picture:  how come the barge on the right of the image has a mast and sail erected?  To reach this location, surely it must have passed under several low bridges.  Can anyone suggest an explanation?

Looking at these and other images of the Oudegracht in former times, I almost regret that today we have all those tall trees obscuring the view of these elegant canals, bridges and buildings.  And I really like trees!

comment.author: 40016553@N03
comment._content: I guess the mast can be pulled down, otherwise it's impossible to get there indeed...

comment.author: 12143670@N05
comment._content:
Well, yes, it makes sense that the mast can be dismantled, but why erect it again at this point?  No sailing to be done here.

Maybe erecting the mast was the best way to keep it out of the way when loading and unloading.  Still, I'd be curious to hear from anyone who knows about these barges and how they worked.
